cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with distributed storage systems, which are typically studied in the computer science subfield of distributed systems (cs.DS). However, the paper specifically focuses on coding schemes for these systems, which suggests that it may also fall under the subfield of coding theory (cs.IT). Additionally, the paper discusses security and local-repairability, which are both topics that are often studied in the subfield of cryptography (cs.CR). The paper also mentions bandwidth efficiency, which is a topic that falls under the subfield of computer networks (cs.NI) but is also relevant to distributed systems. Finally, the paper may also be relevant to the subfield of signal processing (cs.SP) due to its focus on coding schemes for distributed storage systems. Overall, cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.CC, and cs.SI are all likely sub-categories for this paper.
